We stayed here along our cross country Roadtrip with our 2 dogs! This place was absolutely lovely. It’s tucked into a cute suburban neighborhood that is so peaceful and quiet. The tiny home itself was very beautiful & had everything you could possibly need for your stay. We even cooked our dinner on the stove with the provided kitchenware. Devon is an amazing host, very responsive and attentive.
Don’t forget to say hello to StreetTaco the neighborhood stray kitty :)

review_text:
Great place to stay in a nice and peaceful neighborhood. Guest house was clean, and the amenities were good. I will definitely stay here again when I come back in town. Devon was a great host: friendly, responsive, and easy going.
The only things I'll note that might be an issue for some people are these two things:
- If you use the restroom a lot like I do throughout the night, then you do have to go downstairs to use it. The bedroom is upstairs.
- The shower is small. For me it wasn't an issue, but if you're a person that needs some space to shower, then it'll be a tight squeeze.

What can I say, if you’re thinking of booking this Airbnb, do it! Maria is amazingly friendly and responsive and seems like a genuinely awesome person. And this comes through in the personality of this comfy, homey, truly amazing Airbnb. You can tell Maria is a thoughtful person in the above and beyond accommodations and thoughtful decorative touches in this Airbnb!
We got in late and easily checked in. There was candy waiting for us, which was an amazing touch after a long trip! We slept in their comfy beds and woke up to a fully stocked coffee station. Enjoyed our coffee on the comfy couch in the peaceful, clean, living room. Gosh, what a lovely respite while we are traveling across the country!
One of the best Airbnbs I have ever stayed in. We will definitely be coming back when we come through Wichita Falls again. Thank you!!

Not sure if Shannon is an Interior Decorator but if she isn't, she should be, the design is very nice and relaxing. Our dog, Oliver, enjoyed the back yard, which has a nice wood privacy fence and lots of trees. Nice patio area to enjoy a glass of wine or coffee while your pet runs around. The TV was easy to use and the kitchen was well stocked. Can't wait to return. Thanks again, Shannon, it was the perfect stay. Appreciate it!

Stayed over a week
review_text:
The Fain Casa is a cozy 3-bedroom home with really cozy beds. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need for longer stays (oven, microwave, food processor, toaster, fridge/freezer and various other utensils). Dryer and washing machine are also provided. The living room offers a cozy large couch overlooking gas fire pit and TV. Wifi is fast and the TV offers various channels and streaming services (Netflix, Amazon, etc.). All in all, a cozy house that is thoughtfully decorated and has a certain flair.
The most amazing thing about the stay was communication with Shannon. She really always responded very quickly to all the queries and was able to answer any questions we had. Every now and then we also found a little surprise at the door (the banana bread was great!). Shannon was also very flexible when we had to book an additional 2 nights at short notice. Everything really went smoothly!
Thank you again for the wonderful time, gladly again ;)

review_text: Shannon's house is wonderful! My family of 6, which includes four children 10 and under, stayed here for 6 weeks this summer. We all had plenty of room and we were very comfortable. The house is in a great location. It is a nice quiet street that is only minutes from everything you would need. Shannon was great too! She went above and beyond when it came to making sure our stay was perfect. When small issues came up, as they do in any house, she addressed them immediately and it was like it never happened at all. Normally being away from home for extended periods of time is stressful, but Shannon made sure this wasn't the case. In addition to the wonderful hospitality, she was also very knowledgeable about the area and recommended many places to us when we asked. If we are ever in the area again we will definitely stay at Shannon's again!

Great house and a great experience!
Shannon was an excellent hostess! Offered to meet us and get us oriented though we didn't need it.
The house was very clean and organized, yet cozy and we felt right at home as soon as we walked in. It is nicely furnished and though an older home it has been updated with modern appliances and other touches. Shannon had purchased some food for us which was a nice touch and much appreciated!
The house is well situated being only a few blocks from 3 major thoroughfares and Midwestern State University, yet the neighborhood was very quiet and there was little traffic in the area.
The carport was a great plus since we didn't have to leave the car in the hot sun on an asphalt parking lot at a hotel.
We'll be back!

We have received a small impression of life in a Texas town, from the manicured surroundings, the friendly neighbors and what it means to live in a hot and dry country. Thanks to Shannon for the peek into their beautiful decorated privat environment. Shannon great host and she was immediately in support when we needed help.

My party of 6, 3 adults and 3 children came to Wichita Falls and stayed at Shannon's place for 2 nights. This is not ordinary rental, barely furnished and cold; but instead it was warm and decorated with love, it was home away from home.
Shannon was there when we arrived and greeted us with a smile, showed us around the house and then exited with the reminder to contact her if we needed anything.
Wichita Falls is HOT in summer and the central AC was more than adequate. The king bed was firm and the queen soft. There was plenty of seating, and a fully fenced private backyard.
We had a great time there and will definitely be repeated customers of this delightful home in a nice university neighborhood, near everything!

For once we didn't have to run to the store right away for necessities. Speaking of going to the store. A superwalmart is conviently located only about 1/2 mile away. Sweet! Walmart is just down the road as are many convenience stores.
From the off road parking to the quiet and sunny private garden it is all excellent! The laundry, cooking facilities, bathroom, air conditioning & heating, comfortable lounge and bedrooms are all good too!
I have given the house a 5 star rating.

name: Ryan
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2022
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
We had a great stay. Really unique location. We were driving from Colorado to Texas and needed a place to stay. A few quick thoughts:
1) Extremely well decorated. No clutter. Minimalistic. Modern.
2) Beds were great. Nice pillow options. High quality memory foam type beds.
3) Unique location. So, so cool to park in what used to be the drive-through teller. Loved that it used to be a bank.
4) Big windows. We love lots of natural light and this delivered.
5) Very downtown feel. But without the complexity of complicated parking. We almost could have fit our 30' travel trailer in the parking lot (although we didn't have it with us).
6) Lots of walkable things. Love that.
7) Kitchen was minimally equipped. Don't expect to cook a Thanksgiving meal but enough for very simple cooking.
8) Loved the sustainable nature of the shampoo and conditioner. Nice little touches.

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
What a unique place and location. I am from Wichita Falls and remember this place when it was a Bank, to see it in transformation into two apartments was amazing. The space was bright with ambient light, tons of parking, and quiet (even though it was at the intersection of downtown streets). The two rooms were separated by the kitchen/dining/living area which gave great privacy to each guest.
Shea, allowed us to check in early, I did not even have to ask, I only had to notify her of our travel and arrival plans. They were readily accepted when I had to change my dates of travel, and even offered a refund when my new dates were cheaper.
I will deffinatly seek out this location for my future travels to Wichita Falls.

name: Tony
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: What a funky-awesome place to stay in Downtown Wichita Falls! It may go without saying, we booked this amazing venue during the Hotter'n Hell festivities. We hoped that we would be near the center of all the action while having a comfortable place to stay. Well, this BnB WAY SURPASSED that! As the listing notes, this converted bank (how cool is that?) is super cozy, well accommodated, and within walking distance of the Multi-Purpose Event Center, along with a ton of excellent restaurants. Seriously, it felt like it was almost too good to be true! Additionally, Cody and Shea, the hosts, were quick to answer any question and provide info and local guidance upon request. Honestly, it doesn't get any better than this!

Cody’s place is unique and charming. We found it surprisingly quiet considering its location in the heart of downtown. The location was easy to find, had ample parking, was close to some great restaurants and only a short distance to the freeway.
We loved the decor and the natural light in the unit, and found it to be the perfect size for our extended stay. It is easily accessible for someone with a wheelchair or other limited mobility, and was also just a short walk to our favorite coffee shop (8th St. Coffee House).
Cody and Shea were very responsive to our inquiries and all of our interactions were pleasant and polite. They have a real hidden gem here with the Vault.
We enjoyed our stay here very much!

review_text: We've stayed in penthouses, townhouses, condos and luxury apartments since I first started using Airbnb. This has been my favorite. So cute, just enough space for 4 people, no space is wasted. Super quiet (at least over the holidays when we were there), we felt safe the entire time. Plenty of supplies, more than most airbnbs I've rented. The door code didn't work for us at 11:30 p.m. Christmas Eve night but Cody was quick in answering our phone call and we promptly got in, even at that hour. The most original stay we've ever had - a former bank! Very well done, lots of care and thought went into the reno. We will certainly use again. Thank you so much for an unforgettable, comfortable stay for my family during Christmas.

review_text: I was the first guest to stay in this Airbnb and it was so much more than expected! The location is prime with several places to eat and drink within walking or a short driving distance. Cody was very communicative and checked in to make sure everything was good a few times. There are several neat things about this home not to mention, it’s an old bank. Water bottles, coffee, and even a delicious piece of artisan chocolate were available for me. The home was very stylish with good quality shampoo, conditioner, and body wash available for use. It took everything in me to not leave with a few of the plants that are used as decoration in the home, but available for purchase! However, I was staying here for work and wouldn’t be able to transport them back! I highly recommend this place! Can’t wait to visit again and check out the other side!

review_text: Had a very good stay here. House was clean and in a great location for my short visit. Marilyn was extremely responsive on the few times I reached out to her. It was so hot while I was there so it was nice to be able to cool off in the pool. The pool was a nice size and the only negative thing is that there wasn’t a vacuum so I spent a lot of time skimming it so we could swim. it collected a bunch of leaves and grass and then when the kids would get in it would stir up what was in the bottom of the pool and float to the top. There were several floating devices in the barn which was nice. The bed in the master bedroom is very firm but the other beds in the house are a little softer. Overall, I enjoyed staying at Marilyn’s place and would stay again in the future.

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We had a great stay at Marilyn's! The home was clean and comfy and had everything we needed for the week. We loved the pool, and the kids had a ton of fun with the provided pool toys and riding toys in the garage. It was great having garage access due to the heat and storms and there were games and some toys inside for when it was too hot outside. As a parent with small children, having the pool behind a locked gate was a huge plus, and we wouldn't have felt comfortable staying otherwise.
The location felt very peaceful and private and provided easy access to main roads and restaurants, attractions, etc. Marilyn provided easy to understand instructions for check in and out and we appreciated that the required check-out cleaning was minimal. She was very easy to reach when we had questions and was quick to respond. We'd love to stay again if we're ever back in Texas!

I would suggest the Host add a Nest thermostat to remotely adjust temperature as the house rules of 80 in the summer meant the home did not cool below 78 until after 10pm. Also, being a first time AirBnB customer I had no knowledge base upon which to judge the cleaning fee of $150. After viewing the House rule requirements of guests the amount seems excessive and not in line with comparable AirBnB properties. As for the value, upon reflection a charge of over $600 for one night is a large sum but I was able to spend time with all of my children and grandchildren for the first time in over 2 yrs. My desire to visit with family outweighed my economic sensibilities, so for most people the cost will far outweigh the benefits. As for me, we will go back to a few adjoining suites and pocket the savings.

When we alerted Jorge of this situation (late at night when we arrived back at rental) he went above and beyond to relocate us to another property if necessary. Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a fantastic place to stay if you’re ever in the Wichita Falls area. Very cute, clean, and cozy guest house that has everything you might need. Easy check in, private entrance, assigned parking, and an extremely comfy bed! You can tell Lisa and Norm really care that you have a great stay at their place. I use air bnb a lot and this has to be one of my favorite places I’ve stayed! I was in town visiting my husband for his birthday who is currently training at the Sheppard Air Force Base, which is conveniently located less than a 15 min drive away. This is a safe place if you are solo traveling. It just so happened that 2 of my favorite places we ate at are less than a 5 min drive. If you’re looking for quick fast food check out Braum’s, and if you’re looking for somewhere a little fancier we went to Fox Hill Restaurant & Gardens for his birthday dinner. I’m very thankful for Lisa & Norm, they made my stay in Wichita Falls a memorable one! I highly recommend staring here (:

They had all the things anyone would need in case they forgot toiletries and the place had plenty of bottled water, coffees, and a wide selection of teas.
The hosts were super helpful and accommodating throughout my stay. They even left some muffins and a sweet card when I arrived!
If you get the chance to take some time to yourself in a comfy little gem, go see Lisa and Norm’s place!! Thanks for the stay!!

review_text: I could not say one bad thing about this place if I tried. I stayed here with my boyfriend because he is currently at Sheppard AFB, and it was a perfect little casita. It had everything you could need and Lisa and Norm even provide some things that you might have forgotten such as body wash, loofahs, deodorant and more! We stayed here over Thanksgiving and they went out of their way to make us feel at home and comfortable and they would always respond right away to any questions or anything we had over text. While we were staying here on Thanksgiving, Lisa and Norm provided a delicious meal for us because everything was closed and that meant a lot to us. I read a comment that said “you can tell that they host because they love it” and I couldn’t agree more. I will definitely be staying here if I am ever in Wichita Falls again if I could rate this place a 10/5 stars I totally would! Their hospitality is something that you can’t find often so I had a lovely experience.

review_text: This cozy little place is in a unique and interesting neighborhood and the main house appeared to also have an historical marker on the front. It’s in a winding street neighborhood with lots of trees and a little pond too. Lisa greeted me very warmly and provided helpful info about where I could pick up dinner. The cottage behind the main house is a perfect retreat for one guest. I was amazed at how many thoughtful amenities were packed into the space, yet it felt spacious! No detail was left out! There was a place for luggage, a cute writing desk, FULL kitchen and everything needed to prepare a meal, if one should choose to cook. Lisa and Norm even prepared a delicious dessert snack and a thoughtful welcome note. The place was spotlessly clean. I would highly recommend this charming rental for a solo traveler and if I travel through this way again, I’ll hope that it’s available! Kudos to the hosts, Lisa & Norm.

review_text: This place is a gem!! I was in town for a high school graduation/party, and this was the most beautiful, quiet, cozy place to retreat. The bed is SO comfortable, every detail and available item was thoughtfully selected, purified water cold in the fridge, fantastic A/C, easy in and out. I felt extremely safe as a solo traveler, I liked that I wasn’t inside their house so I didn’t have to be perfectly quiet, and I had every amenity I could have hoped for. Michelle is a thoughtful and helpful host. I found wonderful shops on her suggestions. I will 100% stay here again. Pictures are completely accurate. The bathroom is small, but functional and so cute. Wifi worked great! Sound machine was awesome. Oh, did I say this place was cute?? Soooo cute! Highly recommend for a solo traveler or a couple on a getaway. Perfectly private. Great stay!!
